Database Manager#

class server.lib.database_manager.DatabaseManager(server_host: str, server_port: str, server_db: str, server_user: str, server_pass: str)#

Bases: object

This class contains the logic to establish a connection to a mariadb database server and create sessions where queries can be sent to the database.

Parameters

  • server_host (str, required) – The server IP address of the mariadb database server. (Example: 127.0.0.1)

  • server_port (str, required) – The port on which the mariadb database server is hosted. (MariaDB Default: 29955)

  • server_db (str, required) – The name of the database that the database manager should connect to. (Example: my_database)

  • server_user (str, required) – The username that the database manager should use to establish a connection to the mariadb database server.

  • server_pass (str, required) – The password that the database manager should use to establish a connection to the mariadb database server.

Raises

RuntimeError – If any of the parameters passed through to the constructor is None.

get_engine()#

Retrieves the database engine. Don’t use this to make queries to the database, use make_session() instead.

Returns

Reference to the database engine.

Return type

sqlalchemy.engine.Engine

initialize()#

Initializes the database manager with the connection information provided in the class constructor. During the initialization, the database connection is made and the session factory is established.

Returns

None

Raises

RuntimeError – If the database connection cannot be established due to invalid connection parameters.

is_active() → bool#

Checks if the database engine exists.

Returns

True if the database engine exists.

Return type

bool

make_session()#

Creates a session to interface with the database and returns that session. Please make sure to close any sessions after finishing queries.

Returns

A new session to the database.

Return type

sqlalchemy.orm.Session
